column4: hi there. i've a nvidia vanta graphics card ( 10de:002c (rev 15) ) which i'm unable to get operatable
the hardware-driver window is empty. i installed nvidia-glx-71 and the kernel module seems to get loaded but xorg refuses to load the driver
try a different driver
what release are you using?
jaunty
could try the 96 driver
why should i try a different diver? the vanta card is supposed to be supported by the 71 driver as stated here: http://us.download.nvidia.com/XFree86/Linux-x86/169.12/README/appendix-a.html
well what you have isnt working so to me it makes sense. have you tried modifying xorg.conf?
or reading /var/log/Xorg.log.0
i added Driver "nvidia" and xorg failed to start... (EE) Failed to load /usr/lib/xorg/modules/drivers//nvidia_drv.so
ok did the dkms step of the driver install complete?
yeah i think so. lsmod shows me nvidia is loaded and the dmesg is ok i think
uninstall the driver and in xorg.conf set it to Driver 'nv"
but i do need hw accel :-/
i know, but if you install the driver from fresh it sometimes makes it work
ok. so what do you suggest?
sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get --purge remove nvidia*; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
ok and then? sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-71 ?
run all that and reboot, then once back to desktop, rm ~/.nv*; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-71
re. did as you suggested... no luck error in Xorg-log is: (EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (NVIDIA X driver not found)
not sure then, i'd try different drivers til you hit the gold
